At Purple Void’s lush radiance, Jade Essence’s flowing light—
today, on the first day at the hour of noon, as we perform the Dao-circuits,
the assembly of dharma-adepts here present kindle these three pinches of incense.
May this fragrant smoke ascend through the heavens,
directly offering reverence to the Primordial Great Sage, the Heavenly Worthy of Natural Dao and Power.

May the merit of this incense-offering ascend to honor the numinous presence of the ancestral shrines and the former sages.
We humbly pray that heaven and earth illumine with splendor, the Great Void resonate in harmony.
May they nurture purity in tranquility, resting in the Yellow Chamber;
may they refine the azure emptiness to true essence, ascending directly to the Purple Ultimate.
Bestow auspiciousness upon the ancestral temples, extend blessings to the heir’s palace.

Now, therefore, we burn incense, taking refuge from the master, the revered, the sagely hosts, and the perfected powers.
After attaining the Dao, may they ascend into the formless.

In repentance, circumambulation, subduing demons, pacing the void,
bowing to the scriptures, thrice invoking, and solemnly reciting the dharma-ranks—
we, the assembled officials and altar-attending hosts, with utmost sincerity,
jointly supplicate the Three Clarities’ August Worthies,
the Ten Directions’ Supreme Saints,
the Heavenly Emperors and Perfected of Jade Capital and Golden Towers,
the Ten Directions’ Master Worthies and Sagely Hosts,
the officials of the Three Realms, and all mighty numina.

We have heard that when the Cavernous Mystery revealed its scriptures,
heaven and earth bowed in reverence;
when the Divine Empyrean bestowed its registers,
the netherworld opened its passes to clear the Way.
We, who have long been counted among the true companions,
have presumptuously received the shade of the Dao.
Thus, we ought to guard the Yellow Court and repose within,
inwardly nurturing spirit and form;
to feast on the pure fluid and immerse in study,
outwardly eliminating desires and cravings.
Reverently bearing the imperial mandate, we scrupulously perform our rites.

We humbly beseech that the Dao’s intent shine forth,
the imperial heart deign to regard us.
Bestow the Jade Clarity’s precious registers, refining the body with golden fluid;
confer the Golden Tower’s jade texts, recording names on the Cinnabar Terrace.
Above, we pray for the Earthly Palace;
below, for the imperial presence.
May she grasp the dragon-script, ascend the phoenix-chariot,
enter directly the realm of pure emptiness,
soar to the Great Desert’s expanse.
May she be ranked among the Perfected Immortals,
her name inscribed in the Purple Registers.
Feasting by the Jasper Pool, drifting in radiance,
dwelling in the Flowery Tower, delighting in spirit—
may she realize the Dao in nonaction,
transcend existence to attain the highest.
Above, may the Heavenly Worthy’s great compassion manifest;
below, may our supplications’ sincerity be fulfilled.

Respectfully submitted for your august attention.

First, may celestial grace descend universally;
second, may the talismanic mandate spread afar;
third, may the numinous altar be solemn and vigilant;
fourth, may the myriad saints attend the throne;
fifth, may the thousand Perfected pay homage;
sixth, may the ten thousand qi unite in transcendence;
seventh, may the dead rise from their corpses;
eighth, may beings be delivered to the Southern Palace;
ninth, may heaven be clear and qi bright;
tenth, may rivers and seas be tranquil;
eleventh, may the turning wheel attain the Dao;
twelfth, may all ascend to the Upper Clarity.

Dispersing the qi of dark tranquility and mystery, it crowns the cinnabar clouds; initiating the sound of flourishing emptiness, it inaugurates the jade calendar. What it naturally transforms is without pattern yet luminous.

We, by karmic affinity of former lives, have presumptuously received the numinous assembly. Secretly revering the divine chapters, we leap with joy, gazing afar to contemplate the Perfected. By the great Brahma’s generation and transformation, we diligently cultivate and expound the teachings. In all that we address, we dare not fail to make known.

The intent of the fast and the blue-green memorial shall now be solemnly proclaimed.

Proclamation:
As the words declare, without transgressing sincerity. We beseech the Great Dao to distinguish and grant our prayers.

We have heard that the Dao opened the five kalpas, floating radiance in the empty vastness; the Dharma emerged from the three vehicles, manifesting deliverance within the dark and hidden. Constantly pure, constantly still, it is called sagely, called divine.

We reverently undertake the pure fast, first entering the tranquil night. The divine wind is hushed; the river’s source irrigates the blossoms of the Eastern Well. The jade firmament revolves in splendor; the stone’s shadow emits the essence of the dark yin. Welcoming the host of immortals to extend their shade, gathering the nine qi to contain mist.

Respectfully transmitting incense, we undertake the fast’s vigil. On this evening as we perform the Dao, we, the Dharma assembly, now offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to space, directly offering to the Void, Perfected, Spontaneous, and Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Great Dao.

May the merit of this pinch of incense extend above to bless the present emperor, bestowing boundless fortune. We humbly pray that the Dao harmonize the three subtleties, that he personally receive a hundred blessings. May he abundantly and grandly receive the emperor’s grace without end; majestically and augustly, may he bear the celestial favor ever increasing. May he firmly receive the protection of a hundred million years, eternally bearing the title of the Nine-Five fortune. May the four seas be united, the eight directions settled in submission.

Now we burn incense, from revering the Dao, the honored and sagely hosts, the Perfected’s virtue, to attaining the Dao thereafter, preserving heaven’s long endurance.

We have heard that in the distant and formless, the spirit returns to the court of wondrous existence; in the sudden forgetting of form, the Dao abides in the realm of perfect emptiness. Having earnestly contemplated in silence, our sincere hearts are truly aligned.

On this evening as we perform the Dao, we, the Dharma assembly, now offer the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to space, directly offering to the Jade Dawn, Perfected, Spontaneous, Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Great Dao.

May the merit of this pinch of incense extend above to aid the invoked divine forms. We humbly pray that they refine their substance in the void, congeal their spirits in primordial simplicity. On the cinnabar terrace, the registers are examined, loftily inscribing the record of accumulated goodness; in the purple palace, merits are declared, ascending to the ranks of the highest immortals. May abundant great fortune flourish, protecting the state and the household. May blessings descend upon the heir’s palace, securing peace throughout the realm. May the hundred officials be pure and bright, enabling the six domains to prosper. May the imperial enterprise be eternally assisted, its favored emoluments ever increasing.

I have heard that the Four Symbols sigh in vastness, concealing the Great Void within the Primordial Grotto; the Nine Suns scatter their radiance, suffusing wondrous qi amidst the blossoms of Brahmā. Azure mists spread in array, while dark essences stretch into the distant. The Three Luminaries interpenetrate, nurturing the myriad beings. At the dawn of the Dragon-Han, the Celestial Charts were unfurled; from the transformations of the Primordial Azure, all things arose. The Heavenly Treasures emerged as scriptures to transmit through the world, their divine chapters forming like blossoms; the Jade Clarity responded to its title, delivering humankind, its sacred scripts shimmering with numinous light. The true mechanism was revealed, and the Orthodox Dao flowed forth.

We, your servants, have fortuitously aligned with the Mysterious Chart and gained participation in the lofty model. Relying on the jadelike countenance to inspire wondrous resonance, we turn to attend the morning audience; contemplating the pearl-like utterance to concentrate the spirit, we reverently proclaim the Dharma rites. Whatever we venture to present, we dare not withhold. The intent of the purification rite and the blue-green memorial shall be respectfully declared.

**Proclamation of the Memorial**
As stated in the memorial, without deviation from its earnest sincerity.

We humbly beseech the Most High to distinguish and heed our supplications.

I have heard that formless and shadowless, the divine wind is still and silent, yet illumines the vast firmament; as if present, as if absent, the Four Qi shine brightly, equalizing all in distant harmony. The host of demons bow their heads, and the myriad sages attend the audience.

We, your servants, discerning the signs and refining our thoughts, face the dawn in reverent audience. As the pure wind arises at daybreak, we gaze upon the numinous radiance just ascending; as the Yellow Path begins to shine, we witness the full subjugation of the yin hosts. Precious qi floats in the void above the dark throne; auspicious mists rise high amidst the Great Veil.

Reverently transmitting the incense, we undertake the purification vigil. On this second day at dawn, as we perform the Dao-circulation, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Dao, the Natural and Most Real, the Great Dao of the Void.

May the merit of this pinch of incense extend upward to bless the present emperor, that his august mandate endure without end. We humbly pray that through ten thousand years, his virtue may illumine the four quarters. May the Red Crow stream through the palace, continuing the flourishing of the Fire Mandate; may the divine horse emerge from the river, truly manifesting the auspiciousness of the Heavenly Scriptures. May he be born in harmony with the numinous and grasp the sacred, eternally receiving the registers and charts. May the imperial destiny prosper and flourish, favored by the August Heaven. May propitious omens converge and auspicious blessings all arrive.

Thus we now burn incense, from our refuge in the Dao-Worthy, the Great Sage Assembly, and the virtue of the Perfected, that after attaining the Dao, we may pray for the eternal endurance of Heaven.

I have heard that the Perfect Dao bestows its precepts, and the phoenix scripts descend upon the realm of Pure Subtlety; the Primordial August One promulgates his teachings, and the dragon charts float in the azure vastness of the Empyrean. Universally aiding the hidden and manifest, all equally receive blessings and protection.

On this second day at dawn, as we perform the Dao-circulation, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Numinous Treasure, the Most Sagely and Natural, the Great Dao of Jade Clarity.

May the merit of this pinch of incense extend upward to benefit the spirits we commend. We humbly pray that they may feast in the Jade Capital, advancing through the ranks of the sacred canon. Facing the August Void to receive the Dao, may they ascend the jade steps to attain Perfection. May they dwell forever in carefree ease, abiding eternally in supreme bliss. May they draw from the immortal streams of the Silver River and pluck the celestial blossoms of the Jasper Garden. May their influence moisten the nine provinces and their fragrance transmit through ten thousand generations.

Thus we now burn incense, from our refuge in the Scripture-Worthy, the Great Sage Assembly, and the virtue of the Perfected, that after attaining the Dao, they may ascend into the formless.

I have heard that ever-responsive and ever-quiescent, the numinous light pervades all, and the ten thousand practices are all enacted; perfectly quiescent and perfectly penetrating, the nectar of wisdom universally moistens, and the nine springs are equally succored. The Dao’s compassion is vast, and its supreme virtue all-embracing.

On this second day at dawn, as we perform the Dao-circulation, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the third pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Dao and Virtue, the Natural Transformer, the Great Sage of the Primordial Chaos.

May the merit of this pinch of incense extend upward to benefit the spirits we commend. We humbly pray that they may soar high in the Great Veil and mystically commune with the formless. Drifting in ethereal purity, may they refine their true selves in the courtyard of flowing fire; luxuriant as jade blossoms, may they bear fruit in the halls of the Azure Empyrean. Incense Official Messengers, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attending Incense Spirits—may this place where we have this morning ascended the altar to perform the Dao now naturally generate golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected beings convene here before the incense burner.

We pray that the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions receive this orchid-scented smoke and swiftly transmit the sincerity of our petition directly upward to the Most Perfect and Boundless Dao, the Three Clarities’ August Saints, and the Supreme August Jade Emperor of the Golden Portal before the Celestial Throne.

The second day’s early rite of the Jade Register Grand Retreat now concludes.
The second day’s noon audience rite begins.

All ritual masters, maintain visualization as prescribed:
Within the Yellow Center, summon qi to sever demonic traces and extinguish their trails.
Suppress the sources of evil;
cut off the lineages of demons.
By the Talismanic Mandate of the Most High, summon and command the divine lords.
May all spirits heed this call, averting misfortune and dispelling calamity.
Five qi and three wheels penetrate the true wind;
the Purple Portal unites with jade, and the Six Perfections know no end.
To the left, command the Azure Waist;
to the right, summon the Mushroom Youths.
Wandering freely, riding the radiant light, they govern the Nine Empyreans.
The Mysterious Altar responds to the moment, riding the qi in empty ascension.
May the myriad perfected descend universally, delivering and saving without end.

Ignite the censer as in the morning audience.
Invite the recitation of the dharma ranks.

We, the assembled officiants and altar-attending officials, together with utmost sincerity, reverently address and invoke:
The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous,
The Boundless Dao’s Most High Dao Lord,
The Most High Lord Lao,
The August Jade Emperor on High,
The host of great sage perfected beings of the ten directions who have attained the Dao,
The Lords and Venerables of the Thirty-Two Heavens,
The Jade Void Emperor,
The Great Emperor of the Jade Emperor,
The Eastern Flower, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, and Northern Perfected,
The Golden Portal and Seven-Jewel Jeweled Terrace of the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace,
The Numinous Treasure Perfected Illustrious Sovereign of the Dao,
The thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures,
The Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center,
The Supreme Ministers, Supreme Chancellors, Supreme Protectors, and Supreme Tutors,
The Twenty-Four Perfected of the Great Peace’s Lesser Teaching,
The King of Total Perfection of the Western City,
The Perfected of the Great One,
The Supreme Minister of the Eastern Marchmount and Controller of Destiny,
The Two Perfected Lords Mao, Regulators of Records and Protectors of Life,
The divine immortals who have attained the Dao in the grotto-heavens and named mountains,
The officials and attendants of the Three Realms,
and all true spirits.

We have heard that when the Five Perfections congeal essence, they foreshadow the ancestral radiance of cinnabar;
when the Three Yangs conceal their subtlety, they elude the bounds of kalpas past.
Vast and formless, secluded and imageless,
they coalesce the primordial qi of the numinous Brahman and initiate divine movement in the Crimson Clarity.
Unfolding the Five Chapters, they pervade the ten thousand models.
The Numinous Treasure emerges from the mysteries of the golden script, its phoenix chronicle circulating;
the Cavernous Mystery suspends the brilliance of jade graphs, its dragon script securely established.
Delivering boundless beings, preserving heaven’s enduring existence.

We, unworthy heirs of the immortal lineage, have presumptuously received the Orthodox Unity.
Floating on vermilion blossoms, we inherit blessings, chanting and intoning the jade sounds;
transmitting talismans and registers among the named mountains, we observe and cultivate the precious models.
In all matters we address, how dare we not report them above?

The blue-green memorial of the retreat’s intent shall now be solemnly proclaimed.
Proclaim the memorial.

As stated in the memorial’s words, without deviation from its earnest entreaties.
We beseech the Great Dao to distinguish and heed our piteous prayers.

We have heard that the Golden Writ of the Supreme Ultimate soars as the treasure of the Twofold Mystery’s perfected essence;
the Purple Radiance and Jade Splendor flow as the light of the Nine Empyreans’ divine realm.
Dragons crouch and tigers leap; phoenixes soar and simurghs dance.

We, by day, receive the true spirits; at noon, we approach the altar’s precincts.
The yang essence shines in its correctness, measuring the gnomon’s shadow to align with the center;
the radiant brilliance unfurls its light, gazing upon the cinnabar orb before its decline.

We draw forth the saints of the Dharma Realm’s emptiness and gather the fragrant smoke of the numinous wind’s exuberance.
Respectfully relying on the transmission of incense, we undertake the retreat’s observances.

At this midday performance of the Dao, we, the assembled dharma hosts, now offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void, the Most Perfect and Spontaneous Great Dao.

May the merit of this pinch of incense ascend to bless the present emperor, that his sagely longevity know no bounds.
We humbly pray that he eternally govern the Nine Palaces, fully receiving the Five Fortunes.
Clothed in dignity, he brings order, long presiding over the southern-facing court;
abiding in correctness, embodying the origin, he steadfastly guards the northern star’s domain.
Treading the supreme position with enduring vision, he preserves the glory of the imperial line without end.
The imperial mandate daily renews; the divine foundation towers in heaven.
Pacifying the Four Seas, he grandly extends the myriad years.

Now, as we burn this incense, from our taking refuge in the Dao’s august sagely host of perfected beings and their virtue, to their attainment of the Dao, we pray for heaven’s enduring existence.

We have heard that the Golden Portal and Jade Chamber store the secret of the precious coffer’s jade tablets;
the Jasper Terrace and Vermilion Gardens reveal the auspiciousness of cloud scripts and rosy seal-characters.
Their light illumines the Nine Heavens; their brilliance hangs from the eight corners.

At this midday performance of the Dao, we, the assembled dharma hosts, now offer the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Sagely and Spontaneous Numinous Treasure Great Dao Heavenly Worthy.

May the merit of this pinch of incense ascend to benefit the imperial lineage and ancestral branches.
We humbly pray that the Four Frontiers turn toward the wind, and all vassals admire righteousness.
Climbing mountains and sailing seas, all become tributary ministers;
from the tattooed tribes of Jiaozhi to the distant lands, all fulfill their duties of audience.
Exhausting heaven and earth’s covering and supporting, and the sun and moon’s illumination,
the myriad barbarians in caps and sashes, and the unified standards of cart and script,
all attain peace and tranquility, each realizing their life’s fulfillment.

We, the officiants of this rite and all assembled before the altar, with reverent unity do hereby address and invoke:

The Boundless and Self-So Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and the Natural,
The Supreme Dao Lord of the Limitless Great Dao,
The Most High Lord Lao,
The August Jade Emperor,
The perfected and holy sages of the ten directions who have attained the Dao,
The True Lords and Venerable Ones,
The thirty-two Heavenly Emperors,
The Jade Purity Highest Emperor,
The Great Emperor of the Jade Capital,
The Eastern Flower, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, and Northern True Realms,
The Seven-Treasured Jeweled Terrace of the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace,
The Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord of the Jade Metropolis Golden Portal,
The thirty-six sacred scriptures of the supreme canons,
The Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center,
The High Ministers, High Stewards, High Protectors, and High Tutors,
The twenty-four Perfected of the Great Peace’s lower teachings,
The Sovereign Perfected King of the Western Citadel,
The Perfected of the Great One,
The High Minister of Life of the Eastern Marchmount,
The Two Perfected Lords Mao—Keepers of the Register and Guardians of Destiny,
The divine immortals who have attained the Dao in the sacred mountains and grotto-heavens,
The officials and attendants of the Three Realms,
And all true numina.

We have heard that the Six Harmonies conceal their forms, concealing the primordial qi of the hidden and blended numinous ancestor; the Five Yangs weave the warp of the cosmos, unfolding the luminous heaven of Brahma’s treasures. Radiance illumines the distant and obscure; brilliance soars in dazzling splendor. Far-reaching, it embraces the Nine Poles; in totality, it governs the Three Luminaries. It inaugurated the kalpic destiny of the Highest Antiquity and responded to the numinous chart of the Great Ultimate. It divided the immortal realms of the cavernous divine and inspired the texts of transformation and life; it produced the sacred talismans of the divine treasures, floating in the void and forming their sigils. It propelled the tally of the celestial reckoning and thereby delivered the people of heaven.

We, unworthy as we are to stand upon the ranks of the perfected, have presumptuously wandered within the arcane teachings. We have drifted upon the wondrous scene of the Yellow Flower and concentrated our gaze upon the sacred texts; we have unfurled the purple bamboo slips of the profound and obscure and followed the regulations and precepts. In all that we now present, we dare not withhold it from the hearing of the Most High. The intent of this fast is expressed in the blue-green memorial, which we now humbly proclaim.

Proclamation of the Memorial
As the words of the memorial declare, without deviation from our earnest supplication:

We implore the Great Dao to distinguish and heed our sorrowful entreaty.

We have heard that the Mysterious Portal of the Jade Purity nurtures the essence of the three luminaries’ souls and spirits; the Golden Realm of the Purple Clarity floats the purest qi of the ninefold yin and yang. It communicates with the divine and enters quiescence, summoning the true and drawing forth the numinous.

We, with reverent devotion, have diligently cultivated the wondrous teachings on this propitious night. Concealing the clouds and veiling the obscurities, we have spread the four seasons to illumine the clarity; revolving the Dipper and traversing the Winnowing Basket, we have received the three luminaries in resplendent brilliance. The precious canopy commands the chariots of the host of perfected; the jade censer emits the nine-colored smoke.

With respectful reliance upon the transmission of incense, we undertake the fast and vigil. At this hour of the setting sun and the performance of the Dao, we, the assembled officiants of the Dharma, now offer the first pinch of incense.

May this incense smoke ascend directly into the void to offer reverent devotion to the Boundless and Self-So True and Natural Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy.

May the merit of this pinch of incense extend upward to bless the present emperor, that his sagely longevity be without end. We humbly pray that the five phases maintain their order, the six pitch-pipes harmonize their qi. May the sun and rain be timely, aligning the seven regulators’ jade pivots; may there be neither scorching heat nor freezing cold, harmonizing the four seasons’ jade candles. May yin and yang unite in virtue, matching the sun and moon in shared radiance. May the world’s paths be greatly pacified, the years yield abundant harvests. May he share the heavens’ eternity, his mandate flourishing and renewed.

For this purpose, we now burn incense, from our reverent devotion to the Dao, the honored and sagely host, the virtue of the perfected and true, that after attaining the Dao, we may pray for the heavens’ enduring presence.

We have heard that the texts of planting completion in heaven and earth bring protection to the family and peace to the state; the transformation and nurturing of yin and yang establish the models for delivering the dead and saving the living. The record-keepers of the heavens and the myriad sages attend the imperial throne.

At this hour of the setting sun and the performance of the Dao, we, the assembled officiants of the Dharma, now offer the second pinch of incense.

May this incense smoke ascend directly into the void to offer reverent devotion to the Jade Dawn Perfected and Sagely Natural Numinous Treasure Great Dao Heavenly Worthy.

May the merit of this pinch of incense flow to the Three Wretched Paths, the Nine Nights, the Six Destinies, and the Four Modes of Birth. May all evil roots be extinguished, and all beings depart from suffering and distress. May they congeal the embryo and return the qi, together ascending to the Azure Empyrean; may they change their substance and shed their forms, all ascending to the Crimson Mound’s precincts. May the dead souls receive refinement and attain immortal transformation to become human. May retribution cease and enmity be resolved. May they transcend the Three Realms and roam freely in the Nine Clarities.

For this purpose, we now burn incense, from our reverent devotion to the scriptures, the honored and sagely host, the virtue of the perfected and true, that after attaining the Dao, we may ascend into the formless.

We have heard that the Great Dao unfolds in silence, thus revealing its scriptures of compassion; the True Origin emerges from the realm of form, thereby bestowing its methods of salvation and deliverance. Through past and present, humans and gods alike have relied upon and revered it.

At this hour of the setting sun and the performance of the Dao, we, the assembled officiants of the Dharma, now offer the third pinch of incense.

May this incense smoke ascend directly into the void to offer reverent devotion to the Primordial Great Sage, the Natural Transformer and Lord of the Dao and its Virtue, the Heavenly Worthy.

May the merit of this pinch of incense extend upward to aid the spirits for whom this rite is offered. We humbly pray that they may forever depart from the clamor of the dust and eternally leave the realm of form. May they congeal the embryo and sever stagnation, containing the harmonious fusion of the primordial qi; may they blend transformation and engender the divine, nurturing the celestial perfected within the mysterious clarity. May they return to their original essence and refine their essence, awakening to the forgetting of both principle and self. May they drift upon the scene of the cavernous void, dispersing their thoughts in the radiance of the clouds. May they roam freely in their numinous chariots, feasting and wandering in the Upper Capital.

For this purpose, we now burn incense, from our reverent devotion to the masters, the honored and sagely host, the virtue of the perfected and true, that after attaining the Dao, we may ascend into the formless.

Repentance
Threefold Invocation.

The Essence stores the subtle and profound, floating high in the pure void. It gathers the qi of the divine blossoms, initiating the radiance of the luminous light. Accumulated titles extend prosperity, unfolding through countless kalpas. It records the jade calendar of the Primordial Numen, congealing into scripture; it unfolds the treasure chapters of the Yellow and Lao, with talismanic seals of emptiness and effulgence. The Eight Potencies settle in tranquility, and the myriad treasures come into being.

We, who hold humble positions in the Mystic Gate and are listed in the Purple Registers, partake in the natural Dao of the Golden Towers, meditating in stillness upon the Perfected; we receive the texts of the Great Existence from brocade pouches, reverently adhering to their precepts. In all matters of memorials and petitions, how dare we not make them known? With sincere intent in our blue-green memorials, we dutifully proclaim and present them.

**Proclamation of the Memorial:**
As stated in the memorial’s intent, we do not deviate from its earnest supplication. We beseech the Great Dao to discern our humble prayers.

We have heard that the Profoundly Quiescent Primordial Honored One governs the Clear and Subtle without dominion; soothing and pacifying the Nine Domains, treading the mysterious workings with impartiality. It broadly bestows the causes of the wondrous Dao, and the hardships of the Supreme Ultimate’s hidden paths.

We, awaiting the dawn, preserve the spirits; at daybreak, we practice the Dao. Purple auroras illuminate the sun as the Azure Dragon first ascends Fusang; crimson radiance streams across the sky as the Solar Chariot journeys through the Eastern Land. The whirlwind returns the wheel to the true realm, and clouds gather like canopies in the Great Void. Reverently transmitting incense, we undertake the fast with devotion.

On this third day at dawn, as we practice the Dao, we invite the assembly of the Dharma to offer the first pinch of incense. May the smoke of this incense ascend directly to offer reverence to the Primordial Honored One of the Void and Perfected, the Natural Great Dao, the Celestial Worthy of Original Beginning.

May the merit of this pinch of incense extend upward to bless the present Emperor, that his august mandate endure without end. We humbly pray that he receive a hundred auspices and align with the Seven Governors. May auspicious grain and vermilion herbs repeatedly bring harmony to the earth’s treasures; may sweet dew and propitious stars manifest the heavens’ blessings. May dragon-horses come from the Western Limits, and phoenixes gather in the Purple Court. May all blessings be fully bestowed, and the Four Spirits assemble. May precious talismans arrive in abundance, and harmonious qi flow everywhere.

Thus, we now burn incense, from our devotion to the Dao, the Venerable, the Great Sage Assembly, and the Perfected’s virtue. After attaining the Dao, we pray for the heavens’ eternal preservation.

We have heard that the Jade Slips bestow texts, serving as the model for humans and devas; the Golden Perfected expound the teachings, becoming the bridge across birth and death. The merit of the wondrous existence is vast, and the transformations beyond naming are profound.

On this third day at dawn, as we practice the Dao, we invite the assembly of the Dharma to offer the second pinch of incense. May the smoke of this incense ascend directly to offer reverence to the Celestial Worthy of the Jade Dawn, the Perfected and Natural Numinous Treasure, the Great Dao, the Celestial Worthy.

May the merit of this pinch of incense extend upward to aid the spirit of [Name]. We humbly pray that the Nine Mysteries and Seven Ancestors, and the karmic kin of countless kalpas, may together ride the vast auroras and soar through the empty caverns. May they ascend to Perfection and awaken to the Dao, accompanying the Nine Elders in roaming; may they refine the mysterious and temper the true, joining the Ten Flowers in chanting and singing. May they sever the summons of the demon officials and cross over to the Upper Southern Palace; may they endure through kalpas, long preserved, and attain deliverance in body. May blessings flow to descendants and felicity extend to clan and kin.

chunks.original_text: 启虚无自然元始天尊，无极大道太上道君，太上老君，高上玉皇，十方已得道大圣众至真诸君丈人，三十二天帝君，玉虚上帝，玉帝大帝，东华南极西灵北真玄都玉京金阙七宝琼台紫微上宫灵宝至真明皇道君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，上相上宰、上保上傅，太平下教二十四真人，西城揔真王君，太乙真人，东岳上卿司命，茅君定录保命二真人，名山洞府得道神仙，三界官属，一切真灵。 臣闻八景潜辉，合太冥於无色； 一阳积气，结梵混於初元。 肇萌上景之光，乃应开皇之号。 玄精发耀，成象流形。 五劫既周，九霄八化，元始肇封於紫典； 敷炳天文，皇人纪律於玉章。 总持劫运，群魔钦顺，万国安宁。 臣等忝与真俦，夙承妙荫。 负九色之圆象，咽液存思； 咏三合之灵章，依科遵奉。 凡有所启，敢不以闻。 斋意青词，谨当宣奏。 宣词 具如词言，不违恳款，恩惟大道，分别哀祈。 臣闻，独露本真，救万劫含灵而咸度； 广宣妙化，济九幽苦趣以无边。 隐显同休，人天仰赖。 臣等恭按斋仪，不遑暇食。 阳晶转烛，方临停午之初； 昼景腾辉，共仰中天之照。 绿辇倾光而回驾，紫烟结篆以浮空。 恭假香传，奉修斋直。 以今第三日中分行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养虚无至真自然大道元始天尊。 愿以是捻香功德，上祝当今皇帝，景命无疆。 伏愿化洽八埏，教行六服。 金穰叶应，三登书大有之年； 王道正明，千载享太平之运。 日表重光之象，星昭循度之祥。 海晏河清，云行雨施。 万方有庆，四海无虞。 今故烧香，自皈依道尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，祈天长存。 臣闻郁罗萧台，乃三清之化境； 洞玄教典，由五劫之出书。 固真长存，保天无极。 以今第三日中分行道，请法众等，运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养玉晨至圣自然灵宝大道天尊。 愿以是捻香功德，上资国祚宗枝。 伏愿碧简题名，丹台纪籍。 发灵光於寿域，益注遐龄； 固劫石於福基，永绥宠禄。 合太和而久视，保真炁以长扶。 嗣续繁昌，姻亲和睦。 今故烧香，自皈依经尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 臣闻，始青肇运，三真俱现而道德圆通； 灵宝度生，万炁长存而魂神澄正。 功惟微妙，形应斯须。 以今第三日中分行道，请法众等，运兹三捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养混元大圣自然化主道德天尊。 愿以是捻香功德，上资所荐神灵。 伏愿偃息清明，从容虚妙。 云衢曜景，超四大於神方； 空洞流音，离九玄於幽裔。 心散重霄之上，炁凝华府之中。 焕落开襟，去留解带。 飞游自在，应感无方。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 忏悔 三启

We now invoke the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous Dao, the Boundless Great Dao and Supreme Lord of the Dao, the Supreme Lord Lao, the August Jade Emperor, the perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the perfected lords and venerable masters, the thirty-two Heavenly Lords, the Jade Sovereign of the Void, the Great Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence and Southern Culmen, the Western Numinous and Northern Perfected, the Mystic Capital and Golden Portals of the Seven-Jewel Jeweled Terrace, the Purple Tenuity and Upper Palace, the Numinous Treasure and Perfected Radiant Sovereign of the Dao, the thirty-six revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Center, the High Ministers and High Chancellors, the High Protectors and High Tutors, the twenty-four perfected of the Great Peace’s lower teachings, the King of Total Perfection of the Western City, the Perfected of the Great One, the High Minister of the Eastern Peak and Controller of Destiny, the Two Perfected Lords Mao of the Register of Life, the divine immortals who have attained the Dao in the grotto-heavens and sacred mountains, the officials of the three realms, and all true numina.

We have heard that the eight luminous scenes conceal their radiance, merging the Great Obscurity with the colorless; the single yang accumulates qi, congealing the Brahma-chaos in the primordial origin. The first sprouting of the light of the upper scene thus responds to the title of the Kaihuang era. Mystic essence emits its brilliance, forming images and flowing into shapes. When the five kalpas had run their course, the nine heavens and eight transformations saw the Primordial Beginning first enfeoffed in the Purple Canon; the celestial patterns were displayed, and the august person inscribed the statutes in jade tablets. Holding fast to the kalpas’ turning, all demons submit in reverence, and the myriad states enjoy peace.

We, unworthy though we are to stand among the perfected, have long received the shelter of their wondrous grace. Bearing the nine-colored round image, we swallow the fluids and hold the visualization; chanting the numinous chapters of the Three Unions, we follow the regulations and uphold them. In all that we now declare, how dare we not make it known? The green-worded memorial of our fast’s intent shall now be respectfully proclaimed.

Proclamation:
As the words declare, without deviation from our earnest supplication, we humbly beseech the Great Dao to distinguish and heed our prayers.

We have heard that the solitary revelation of the original true nature saves all sentient beings across ten thousand kalpas; the vast proclamation of wondrous transformation delivers the nine dark realms of suffering without bound. Hidden and manifest alike flourish, and humans and heavens alike depend upon it.

We, reverently adhering to the fast’s rites, have not paused even to eat. The yang-crystal turns the candle as we approach the first moment of midday; the brilliance of the day’s light ascends, and all gaze upon the illumination of the zenith. The green chariot tilts its light and returns; purple smoke forms talismanic script and floats in the void. With reverence we borrow the transmission of incense to perform the fast’s duties.

On this third day, at the midpoint of the circuit, we invite the dharma assembly to offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void, the Spontaneous, and the True Great Dao.

By the merit of this pinch of incense, we pray for the long and boundless mandate of the present emperor. May his transformation reach the eight borders and his teachings extend to the six directions. May golden harvests correspond to the signs, and the threefold abundance be recorded as a year of great plenty; may the royal way be rightly illuminated, and a thousand years enjoy the fortune of great peace. May the sun’s image shine with doubled radiance, and the stars manifest their orderly auspices. May the seas be calm and the rivers clear, clouds move and rain fall. May the ten thousand regions rejoice, and the four seas know no peril.

For this purpose we now burn incense, from our refuge in the virtue of the Dao, the venerable sagely hosts, and the perfected, that after attaining the Dao, they may long endure in heaven.

We have heard that the Yuluo Xiaotai is the transformed realm of the Three Clarities; the scriptures of the Mystic Teachings emerged from the five kalpas. Thus the true is eternally preserved, and heaven’s protection knows no limit.

On this third day, at the midpoint of the circuit, we invite the dharma assembly to offer the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the Jade Dawn, the Most Sagely, the Spontaneous, and the Numinous Treasure Great Dao Heavenly Worthy.

By the merit of this pinch of incense, we pray for the imperial line and the ancestral branches. May names be inscribed on the azure tablets and recorded in the cinnabar registers. May numinous radiance shine forth in the realm of longevity, adding distant years; may the foundation of fortune be as firm as the kalpa-stone, eternally securing favor and emolument. May the union of great harmony endure, and the preservation of true qi long sustain. May descendants flourish and multiply, and affinal kin live in harmony.

For this purpose we now burn incense, from our refuge in the virtue of the scriptures, the venerable sagely hosts, and the perfected, that after attaining the Dao, they may ascend into the formless.

We have heard that the Beginning Azure inaugurated the turning, the Three Perfected all appeared, and the Dao and virtue were perfectly communicated; the Numinous Treasure delivers living beings, and the ten thousand qi long endure, while souls and spirits become clear and upright. The work is subtle and wondrous, and forms respond in an instant.

On this third day, at the midpoint of the circuit, we invite the dharma assembly to offer the third pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the Primordial Great Sage, the Spontaneous Transformer, and the Heavenly Worthy of the Dao and its Power.

By the merit of this pinch of incense, we pray for the spirits being offered to. May they rest in clarity and ease, moving with leisure in the empty and wondrous. May the cloud thoroughfares shine with radiance, transcending the four great elements in the divine realm; may the empty void flow with sound, departing the nine mysteries of the dark borders. May their hearts scatter above the layered heavens, and their qi congeal within the flowery palaces. May they unfasten their robes and loosen their sashes, free in coming and going. May they fly and wander at will, responding to stimuli without limit.

For this purpose we now burn incense, from our refuge in the virtue of the masters, the venerable sagely hosts, and the perfected, that after attaining the Dao, they may ascend into the formless.

Repentance:
We now make the Threefold Invocation.
